intro: Erigeron lilacinus, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open areas such as prairies, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, with white ray florets surrounding a yellow disk. Erigeron lilacinus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to stabilize soil.
